FuncDef:
The dot1x authentication trigger command enables the device to initiate EAP authentication.
The undo dot1x authentication trigger command restores the default configuration.
By default, the device is disabled from initiating EAP authentication.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The following packets can be sent to trigger the access of 802.1X users:
EAP Start packetsDHCP Discover packetsARP/IP packets
By default, EAP authentication can only be triggered by sending an EAP Start packet. If EAP authentication needs to be triggered by sending a DHCP Discovery packet or an ARP/IP packet, run the dot1x authentication trigger command to enable the device to initiate EAP authentication. The EAP Start packet triggers the pop-up of the client interface, from where the user enters the user name and password to start the authentication.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
